intro: Vellozia leucanthos, commonly known as the white-flowered vellozia, is a striking member of the Restionaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is a notable species in its native habitat.
